item.title: Scaling Instruction Finetuned Language Models (2022)
item.description: Instruction finetuning is a technique for enhancing the zero-shot performance of large language models (LLMs). The seminal work, Finetuned Language Models Are Zero-Shot Learners, refers to this method as instruction tuning. Building on this, Scaling Instruction-Finetuned Language Models explored scaling the number of tasks, model sizes, and the incorporation of chain-of-thought (CoT) data. Their findings demonstrate that instruction finetuning can significantly improve LLM performance across a wide range of settings.
